title: Chateauneuf-du-Pape 'Pure'
content:
Hi,

Stumbled across this image on a wine blog and I really like the typeface used for ’pure’. Whatthefont could not identify it so I wonder if skilled humans could fare better? I’d say it has some Emigre-quality to it, but I could not recognize it among their fonts.

Thanks for any suggestions!

/p

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080913040218im_/http:/typophile.com/files/DSC06028_5307.JPG)

 [‹ Pretty script fonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20080913040218/http:/typophile.com/node/48478 "Go to previous forum topic") [Help with a font ID ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080913040218/http:/typophile.com/node/48808 "Go to next forum topic")
author: guermantes

comments.content:
\> _Whatthefont could not identify it so I wonder if skilled humans could fare better?_

This is nothing short of an insult. _Of course_ we fare better, and how. You’re talking about the most efficient type identification team in the known universe here. ;^) :)D

@BC  
I know :) I just wanted to mention that I had tried to do my homework before asking for help. Thanks!

\> Of course we fare better, and how.

But almost an _hour_, Yves? Tsk, tsk, tsk.

hhp

Hey, since they discontinued e-mail notifications I have to rely on chancing upon unidentified ID requests when I visit Typophile. :^P

FYI This one was identified instantaneously — all it took was the time to write my reply and link to the font. ;^)
